utterance.speaker: DALE TANNER
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: An explosion! Is this incoming artillery fire from above? No, Rommel’s troops have driven our boys into a minefield. Will the M4 Sherman tank’s armor be able to withstand this cowardly barrage from below?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes it can! And the Sherman smashes through Nazi lines to reach the – Whoa. That is not the Suez Canal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If you’re trying to decide what to wear, just keep wearing what you’re wearing now. Or less.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Pervert!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is Field Marshal Pervert to you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? Can you grab that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is Detective Beckett’s office. Seriously? A car bomb?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. Talk about heightened police presence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. What is this? Something’s not right. Hey Espo. Why are they taking the car away? CSU’s not done with it, is it?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They were barely started before the Feds came in and seized the vehicle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would they seize the vehicle?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I tried to ask but they iced me out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s in charge?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: See that guy over there? His name is Agent Guerrero.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Trust me. He’s not going to budge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Agent Guerrero, I’m Detective Beckett –

utterance.speaker: AGENT GUERRERO
utterance.content: Let me save you the trouble. We’re taking the car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: CSU hasn’t finished processing it yet. This is a murder scene. I’m going to need to find out who the victim was.

utterance.speaker: AGENT GUERRERO
utterance.content: I’m sorry, but that vehicle is part of a federal investigation. And if you people hinder us in any way, I’ll arrest you for obstruction.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell is going on here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And why is Homeland Security involved?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. This whole thing stinks. According to witnesses, those two guys were staking out the car even before it blew up. And Homeland Security isn’t letting me talk to them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A mysterious car bombing, the Feds giving us the boot, and now men in black. I’ll say it. I’m intrigued.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who are you guys? Identify yourselves.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey guys. You get this a lot? Agent J, Agent K?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why were you guys surveilling that car? Who was in it when it exploded?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey! Hey! Well, we don’t have a body, we don’t have a crime scene, and we don’t have any witnesses, but –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At least we have each other.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We still have a homicide to solve.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. I think I got an ID on our vic. A uniform found this wallet about a half a block down that way. Matches the description of the guy that witnesses saw get in the car. His name is Dale Tanner.

utterance.speaker: BETH TANNER
utterance.content: I always knew this day might come. Dale did too. It was one of the hazards of his job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of a job would lead to this?

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: When Dale was 16 his father was convicted of murder in Texas. Wrongly convicted. Right before the retrial his father died in prison and so fighting for the underdog, that kind of became his life’s mission.

utterance.speaker: SHAWN TANNER
utterance.content: So about 10 years ago he started the website. Whistleblower Anonymous.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know that site. He exposed the waterboarding memos, the Orton geo-fracking scandal. I had no idea he was the one behind it.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: Dale felt it was more important to keep attention on the issues rather than himself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was your husband working on anything recently?

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: Yeah, I think he was planning on posting some documents. And whatever they were they were making him nervous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are the documents now?

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: Probably at his law office in Queens.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would Homeland Security be interested in your husband?

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: Half the government was interested in my husband. After he posted those photos of Abu-Grave they tried to get him to reveal his sources. They harassed him, followed him everywhere he went. It got so bad that we actually moved into our rental unit in Queens. He said that he was concerned about our safety.

utterance.speaker: SHAWN
utterance.content: And now he’s dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Tanner, witnesses say that your husband parked on Mercer just before 8, waited on the sidewalk until 8:15, and then got back into his car. Do you know what he was doing downtown?

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: I have no idea. He felt like the less we knew the better. I should have talked to him more.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he work with anyone else who might have known what he was involved in?

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: He had a partner, but I have no idea who it was.

utterance.speaker: SHAWN
utterance.content: Why are we even talking to them, Mom? The government killed my father and you’re helping them cover it up.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: Shawn, please.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Now I’m not going to call this a cover up, but I will say this. The Feds are not helping us out. They won’t tell us what evidence they found in Tanner’s car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so we’ll just work it from other angles. We know he had a partner. Why don’t we look into his phone records, see who it was.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Because they’re not being released to us. Neither are Tanner’s financials.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe we can get it from his law office?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We tried to search there; they sealed the place and they took his computers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. I’m starting to see what you mean by the Feds not helping.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then we’re just going to solve this without their help. Where are we on motive?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well there’s plenty of that to go around. Tanner wasn’t afraid to take on the big boys. Banks, big oil, dirty politicians. In the past year he posted highly damaging, and, I might add, truthful information on 30 corporations, government agencies, and individuals. And that’s just what I found before his site was taken offline. With no solid information it’s hard to even know where to start.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We start with manner of death. We know we’re dealing with a bomb, a bomb that was already in Tanner’s car.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right, because if he stayed near the vehicle no one could have tampered with it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And whoever planted the bomb had to have access to the car at an earlier point.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Like in his garage. That’s where the car was before Tanner drove it down town and when I talked to neighbors, one of them saw an unfamiliar motorcycle jet out of the garage last night at 1AM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did they happen to get a plate?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. But this traffic cam did. Bike’s registered to a Monica Lane and get this, she works as a security contractor at Orton Geo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the fracking company Tanner almost put out of business.

utterance.speaker: MONICA LANE
utterance.content: Man, the camera really does add 10 pounds.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You were coming from an apartment building garage before that was taken. What were you doing there?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: That’s none of your business.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It became our business when Dale Tanner got blown to bits.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: What? He’s dead?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. And I bet the company you work for likes him a whole lot better that way.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Look, I had nothing to do with his death. This is not what you think.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then what is it, Monica?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: He and I were seeing each other.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait a minute, you and Dale Tanner?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: We met in the park a few months ago. We just connected.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. I can see you’re real busted up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You were spying on him. Isn’t that what this is really about?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Okay, Orton Geo lost half a billion dollars in contracts because of Dale Tanner. My job was to get close to him and find out who was leaking him information. But it did not involve killing him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Was anyone else after him? Besides you, of course.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, God. His wife. He said she had called. She had just found out about us. She threatened to kill him.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: I felt betrayed. Don’t you see? I stood by him for 24 years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You withheld that he was having an affair and then you went out of your way to make it look like his work got him killed.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: Because it did. All right, look, I admit it. I said some things to Dale. I was upset. Besides, I didn’t go near that apartment –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You could have hired someone else to do it.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: With what money, huh? It’s not like Dale and his website ever made anybody rich.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett? There’s something you need to see.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So CSU sent this over. Based on what little they had they were able to piece together where the explosion originated.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m going to go out on a limb here and say the explosion originated in the car.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right, well, normally a car bomb is placed inside the engine compartment or underneath, but this one went off near the front seat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So it was planted inside the car.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Actually it wasn’t planted at all. CSU found these metal fragments and they were able to trace it to a very specific device. They put together this reconstruction of the explosion.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that a missile?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Specifically a kind of missile deployed from an unmanned aerial vehicle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dale Tanner was taken out by a drone?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: One second Dale Tanner’s sitting in his car, the next – boom.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Poor guy didn’t even know what hit him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This couldn’t have been a drone strike. There’s gotta be a mistake here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: There isn’t. CSU found PVXN-112 explosive residue and fluoridated aluminum from a missile casing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There’s no way that a military drone could fly over New York City and smoke a guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, it could. There’s a drone training facility at Fort Drummond. Ryan, while Castle and I look into that, can you talk to anyone that knew Tanner? Let’s see if we can find out who his partner was.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What, you and Castle are going to Fort Drummond?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, the head of the drone program agreed to a meeting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is going on here? Do you really think the military took him out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t see how they could.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because they wouldn’t cross that line?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because in my experience huge bureaucracies don’t act with that kind of efficiency.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well that’s comforting.

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: No wild theories about the military industrial complex.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just don’t want to believe my country could do something like this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Me neither.

utterance.speaker: HOOPER
utterance.content: Detective Beckett. Mr. Castle. Thank you for visiting For Drummond. So we gathered that you believe that occurred in the city that –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, not an incident. A murder from a drone strike.

utterance.speaker: COLONEL FORTIS
utterance.content: That’s an outrageous accusation, Detective. What do you base it on?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Forensic evidence at the crime scene is consistent with a drone fired missile. How many drones were in the area this morning?

utterance.speaker: FORTIS
utterance.content: That information is classified.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Colonel Fortis, was there a drone flying over New York City at 8:15AM?

utterance.speaker: FORTIS
utterance.content: That’s classified.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, how about this. Did anyone else have access to the drones? Any federal agencies, corporations –

utterance.speaker: FORTIS
utterance.content: That’s classified.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: – classified.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, then I would like to take a look at your flight logs –

utterance.speaker: FORTIS
utterance.content: This meeting is over.

utterance.speaker: HOOPER
utterance.content: Keep in mind, the waivers that you signed prohibit you from discussing what was said here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing was said here.

utterance.speaker: HOOPER
utterance.content: Well then we shouldn’t have a problem.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Touché.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That man over there. He was at the crime scene. Who is he? Does he work for you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t bother. It’s classified.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I don’t know what the hell you guys are up to, but I promise you I will find out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now might be the time for wild military industrial complex theories. And here’s one. Tanner was about to post super-secret military documents. They took him out with a drone and now they’re covering it up. Which, actually, isn’t so wild.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. Maybe they just fired the missile by mistake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And just so happened to hit a vocal critic of the U.S government? And the guy form the crime scene shows up at our Kafka-esque meeting? I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t even know why they took that meeting. All they did was stonewall. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Got a call from CSU. Feds just came in a seized all materials related to the Tanner case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The explosive residue, the fragment samples?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ve been played. They just met with us to find out where everything was and what we knew and then they grabbed all the evidence.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, and now we have no proof that a drone strike ever happened.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re no closer to finding out why it happened or who did it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well maybe Tanner’s partner can tell us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know who it is?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Turns out Tanner taught law classes at Eastborough College to make ends meet and his colleagues say they remember seeing a former student named Omar Dixon hanging around. I talked to Omar’s girlfriend. She said that he did work for Tanner but it was all hush-hush what he did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where’s Omar now?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The girlfriend said she has no idea, but Shawn Tanner might. He attends Eastborough too. Used to drop by and see his dad. Maybe he knows Omar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I think he does. Remember what he did when you asked if he knew his dad’s partner?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He changed the subject.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Boom.

utterance.speaker: SHAWN
utterance.content: I’m telling you, I don’t know him. I don’t know anyone named Omar Dixon.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Look Shawn, I know that law enforcement hasn’t already been on your guys’ side.

utterance.speaker: SHAWN
utterance.content: Try never.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But we’re not the Feds, Shawn. We’re the guys trying to solve your dad’s murder. And no matter what you think, we’re not going to stop until that job is done.

utterance.speaker: ESPSOTIO
utterance.content: Here’s the thing, bro. If your dad was killed for what he put on that website, your boy Omar’s in danger, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Help us out, Shawn.

utterance.speaker: SHAWN
utterance.content: Yeah, I met Omar. I knew him a little. He worked with my dad.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where can we find him?

utterance.speaker: SHAWN
utterance.content: My dad gave me a number for him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We need you to call that number. Tell Omar you’d like to meet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Omar? I’m Detective Kate Beckett.

utterance.speaker: OMAR DIXON
utterance.content: Whoa. Where’s – where’s Shawn?

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: The couldn’t make it. We need to ask you a few questions about Dale Tanner.

utterance.speaker: OMAR
utterance.content: I’m not getting involved.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Omar, you’re already involved.

utterance.speaker: OMAR
utterance.content: Then I’m not getting any more involved. It’s bad enough I saw his blown up car on the news, now I’ve got people following me. And not just you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What people?

utterance.speaker: OMAR
utterance.content: I have no idea, lady. No idea who they are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who killed Tanner? Was it because of the documents he was going to post?

utterance.speaker: OMAR
utterance.content: How they hell should I know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re his partner, aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: OMAR
utterance.content: His partner? Is that what people think? Is that why they’re after me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you’re not his partner then who are you?

utterance.speaker: OMAR
utterance.content: His assistant. I’m his part-time IT guy. I set up his website. He gave me files, I upload them, and for that the cheap bastard paid me $15 bucks and hour.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he tell you what he was working on?

utterance.speaker: OMAR
utterance.content: I didn’t know and I didn’t care. It was just a gig for me. And right now, I’m sorry I ever took it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t move.

utterance.speaker: OMAR
utterance.content: That’s him. That’s one of the guys that was following me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Omar! Omar! Steady. You’re under arrest.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s awfully calm for a guy walking around with a silenced pistol.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, he’s been in rooms like this before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what do we know about Robert Williams?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His ID is fake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about his prints?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There’s no record of them in the system. I don’t know who this guy is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As is my way, I’m going to go with … government assassin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, time to find out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s your name?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Does it matter? It’s not like we’re going to get to know each other.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who had Dale Tanner killed? Were you a part of it? Or was your job just to clean up the mess?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: You’re tenacious. I respect that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was Omar Dixon a part of the mess?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: He went into hiding. By the way, how did you manage to draw him out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll be asking the questions.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: You just won’t be getting the answers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ll see. I can keep you for 24 hours and I fully intend to do so.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: You have me for five more seconds. Use them well.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett? You’ve got a phone call.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Time’s up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is Detective Kate Beckett.

utterance.speaker: SECRETARY
utterance.content: Hold for the Attorney General.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, what? Hold for who?

utterance.speaker: ATTORNEY GENERAL
utterance.content: Thank you. Is this Detective Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, good evening, Mr. Attorney General, yes it is.

utterance.speaker: ATTORNEY GENERAL
utterance.content: Do you have a man by the name of Robert Williams in custody?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes we do.

utterance.speaker: ATTORNEY GENERAL
utterance.content: I need you to release him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Release him? I –

utterance.speaker: ATTORNEY GENERAL
utterance.content: I’m asking this of you as the highest ranking law enforcement official in the country.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, sir, with all due respect, a man has been killed and he is a person of interest.

utterance.speaker: ATTORNEY GENERAL
utterance.content: This is a direct order and I expect you to follow it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine. But then I’m gonna want something in return.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Yes, sir. I fully understand. Thank you, sir.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Well played, Detective Beckett. So, what do you want to know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why don’t we start with who are you?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Jared Stack, special investigator for the Attorney General’s office.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve never heard of it.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: You’re not supposed to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what is your connection with Dale Tanner?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Tanner was under scrutiny by the FBI, DHS, and the pentagon, not to mention the NYPD counterterrorism unit. Somebody objective needed to look into his death, so they picked me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When did you realize he was killed by a drone and not a car bomb?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Once our people examined the wreckage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why the fake ID?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: I didn’t know where this was headed. The AG needs deniability.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The secretary will disavow all knowledge of your actions. It’s Mission Impossible.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Pretty much. I’m even wearing a mask.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You claim that you have no idea where this is headed, but it seems pretty clear to me. The military launched an attack against Tanner.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: I went over the logs at Fort Drummond. It didn’t come from there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where did it come from?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: That’s what I’m trying to find out. The fact is, we’ve lost a number of drones. Some of them have fallen into enemy hands.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So one of our enemies killed Tanner? With a drone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That theory is highly improbable. And coming from me, that’s saying something.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Think of it this way. Let’s say our government wanted Tanner dead. Why not just gun him down on the streets? Why use a drone. Why get rid of him in a way that could bounce back on them?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Same reason most killers do. ‘cause they think they’re going to get away with it.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Stack. What? You’re sure. All right, uh … send me a link to that feed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: That was one of my colleagues. The drone wasn’t from Fort Drummond, but it was one of ours.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: This is video feed off a drone on a routine training run from the international guard base near Syracuse at 8:16 this morning. Would you mind shutting those blinds?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s flying the drone?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Funny you should ask. The pilot lost control 9 minutes earlier over Long Island.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, what do you mean, lost control?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Take a listen for yourself.

utterance.speaker: COMMANDER
utterance.content: Okay, try rebooting the console software.

utterance.speaker: COMMANDER
utterance.content: Wait, what the hell is that? Are you running a targeting protocol on that vehicle?

utterance.speaker: COMMANDER
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Somebody hacked into that drone and took out Dale Tanner.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why is it so hard to believe? People hack in to banks all the time. The Pentagon, NASA.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but a drone? Maybe the pilot was just pretending he wasn’t flying.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no, you can’t fake that kind of panic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I agree. He was having a pants-soiling moment. But there is one possibility we are neglecting. The drone itself. It’s Rise of the Machines. Not unlike SkyNet and the Terminator.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The machines have achieved consciousness and they a pissed.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Sorry to disappoint, Mr. Castle, but it’s a human perp we’re after. NSA picked up an encrypted signal that was sent out the exact moment the pilot lost control. That signal basically overrode the controls and allowed the hacker to take over the drone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where did this signal come from?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: From the lower half of the state of New York. Uh, NSA’s trying to narrow that down as we speak.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So for all we know we’re looking for some 14 year old nerd with a computer?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: It’s not likely. Whoever did this had to know how to defeat the signal encryption and have the software to run the drone. Warburg.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s a Warburg?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: It’s not a what, it’s a who. He’s the only guy that could have pulled this off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. How do we find him?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: He’s been off grid for about a year. The guy’s a real ghost. You’ll never find him. But I might by tracing the signal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe we can work on this together.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Hey. I agreed to tell you what I knew, which I’ve done. It’s been real fun, Detective Beckett, but I’ll take things from here, all right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. And here I thought we all had bonded.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Warburg hacked that drone then he’s our murder suspect and I’m not buying Stack’s word that we can’t find him. Let’s dig into this guy and see what we’re dealing with.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Simon Warburg, a programming legend, overcame severe OCD to become chief designer for the operational software used in military drones.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, he got busted for sabotaging that software but he fled before the FBI could arrest him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Warburg. Sounds like a Bond villain, right? Petting his cat while forming a plan for world domination. And what is that plan, you ask?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually I didn’t ask.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Talking about the boys. To create a drone army. A drone army that can think. That possesses awareness. And who better than the programming genius who designed their software to give them that spark of life?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you don’t actually believe that. And keep in mind, if you say yes I will find you less attractive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well it is conceivable and I have to say, a far better story.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, check it. Warburg posted a video just before he went into hiding.

utterance.speaker: SIMON WARBURG
utterance.content: People don’t understand why I tampered with the drone software.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s Warburg? I was expecting –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Doctor Evil?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, someone a little less nerdy.

utterance.speaker: WARBURG
utterance.content: It’s because I’ve seen the future. And I know their plan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here it is. Building a drone army.

utterance.speaker: WARBURG
utterance.content: They’ll introduce surveillance drones to monitor traffic. Seems harmless enough, right? So we let it happen. Next there’ll be security drones. Because who doesn’t like to feel safer. And then armed drones, to protect our skies. And by then it’s too late. Because the system to monitor, to control, to kill any one of us will already be in place. Someone has to stop this. Even if that someone is me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He wasn’t building a drone army, he was preventing one from being built. I was pretty close.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If by close you mean opposite. Warburg believed that drones were going to be used to target US citizens. That’s why he killed an activist like Dale Tanner – to show us the future was already here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This guy basically framed the government to try to stop drone use.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we get Warburg, we get our killer. And I think I know how. Guys, look at those books.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All on science, all first editions. That’s Origins of Species.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he was a book collector.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A book collector with OCD. A habit like that would die hard.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll start checking antique book stores in the morning, see if Warburg contacted any of them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The tank is going to get it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett! Beckett, get up. We’ve gotta go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You totally fell for it. You acted like it was Rise of the Machines!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No I didn’t. I – I didn’t think it was Rise of the –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If that was actually a killer tank, you bailed!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I went to get the bat to protect you and eliminate the threat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? There’s a camera here, Castle. I saw the look on your face. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Beckett, sorry to call you so late, but I think I got something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, what are you doing at the precinct?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, I was looking at websites of antique bookstores and I was checking out one near Woodstock and I think I’ve noticed a pattern.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of a pattern?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: According to this inventory grid, the bookseller sold seven books on the same day last month. And I see all seven of those books on one shelf of Warburg’s bookcase.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Either that’s a statistical impossibility, or -

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or Warburg is rebuilding his book collection one shelf at a time.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which would mean he ordered books from this bookstore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah… that aroma. Old leather and moldering paper. It’s official. I love this place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, look. It’s ‘Storm Season’.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, on the clearance table.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And the love fades.

utterance.speaker: MARTIN TILLAGE
utterance.content: Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, as a matter of fact, you can. Do you recognize this man?

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: Oh, yes indeed. It’s Mr. Smith. He’s quite a discerning collector. He’s purchased quite a few books from us here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? Smith? That’s original.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have his address? Does he have his books delivered?

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: No, no. He comes in and he picks them up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know what kind of car he drives?

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: Well, he usually rides a bicycle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he’s local.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. I’m going to get the boys to look up all the properties bought or sold in the area over the past year since Warburg went missing. Um…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: Uh … uh … it’s a nice book.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So according to Ryan, the house at the end of this driveway was purchased ten months ago by an attorney.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Warburg is here. I can feel it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you’ve said that about every place we’ve been to so far.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but this time I mean it. The force is stronger with this one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The problem is, it’s private property and I don’t have a warrant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just pretend you don’t see the sign. Look, we’re at the cusp of finding Warburg. At least he’s a person of interest and at most a maniacal supervillian with the power to bend drones to his will. And – – gate’s unlocked.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Burning daylight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe Warburg is here. It is remote and secluded.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just had a deeply disturbing thought.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Much like most of your thoughts?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if Warburg isn’t involved. I mean, we’ve been played before. What if Stack just mentioned his name to send us on a wild goose chase?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh Castle, I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, still. There’s no more proof that Warburg is involved than there is that the drone acted on its own.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seriously? I haven’t gotten that SkyNet thing out of your system yet?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mock me, but mark my words. The day will come. The experts call it the singularity, the emergence of a technological super intelligence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, Castle. Wait, wait. Wait, do you here that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like a buzzing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. I think so.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was just like North By Northwest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, don’t get too excited. It’s coming back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you doing? We’ve gotta run.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re never gonna make it to cover. As soon as it gets in range I’m going to shoot it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Okay, okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. I can’t believe you missed with every shot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Do you think that you shot down that drone with your marksmanship?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I rose to the occasion. No, this time I really did protect you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, along with yourself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, this makes up for what may be considered a momentary lack of manliness. No, I have eared my redemption. Nothing can take that away from me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: These aren’t real bullets. These are blanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Blanks? Well, I didn’t know that, so that doesn’t – that doesn’t diminish the act of heroism. That doesn’t – are those really blanks?

utterance.speaker: SIMON WARBURG
utterance.content: Of course they’re blanks, you idiot. Meant to deter trespassers like you. You just obliterated my finest drone. I’m having the cops arrest you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let me save you a phone call. We’re here about Dale Tanner, Mr. Warburg.

utterance.speaker: WARBURG
utterance.content: Knew somebody would be eventually.

utterance.speaker: WARBURG
utterance.content: Check out the quad. It’s my favorite.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, sweet. Ow!

utterance.speaker: WARBURG
utterance.content: Payback for wrecking my drone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Warburg, let’s talk about Dale Tanner.

utterance.speaker: WARBURG
utterance.content: You want to know if I killed him, the answer is yes I did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Would you like to tell me why?

utterance.speaker: WARBURG
utterance.content: It began two years ago. With this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t understand what a car driving through the desert has to do with Dale Tanner.

utterance.speaker: WARBURG
utterance.content: Intelligence support said there were three high ranking Afghan militants in this car. It was the right make and model traveling at a high rate of speed, so the drone pilot was given the green light to strike. But then he saw those red dots on the trunk and he had a feeling. So he aborted the mission. There were no militants in that car; the red dots were roses because the young couple driving down that desert rode had just gotten married. That’s when I knew I could no longer be a part of the drone program.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t understand why. They pilot didn’t fire.

utterance.speaker: WARBURG
utterance.content: Because the next generation of drones won’t have pilots. The new AI software will give drones decision making capability. They’ll assess the data and take lethal action all on their own.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It really will be Rise of the Machines.

utterance.speaker: WARBURG
utterance.content: Those new drones would turn that car to ash without hesitation. That’s why, when lives are at stake, we need a man who sees roses. We need the human factor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where was the human factor when you killed Dale Tanner.

utterance.speaker: WARBURG
utterance.content: Let me show you something. I wrote this program myself. Note the user-friendly interface. I’m rather proud of it. Now, these red dots are individual drones currently over New York state. Now if I click on one, I can monitor the drone’s function in real time. And with the push of a button I can take over control of the aircraft.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just like you did with Tanner.

utterance.speaker: WARBURG
utterance.content: I was on a bike ride that day and nowhere near a computer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You just said that you killed him.

utterance.speaker: WARBURG
utterance.content: Well I meant my software led to his death. But I didn’t do it. In fact, I was in touch with Dale Tanner. I wanted him to post the program, so I loaded it onto a flash drive and got it to him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You wanted Tanner to post your drone hacking software on his website. If the Pentagon found out they’d have to ground their entire drone fleet.

utterance.speaker: WARBURG
utterance.content: Precisely. It’d bring drone development to a grinding halt. But Tanner refused to post the program. He sent it back saying he didn’t want any idiot with a computer being able to take over control of a drone. Realized he might have a point, so I decided to keep the program to yourself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So if you didn’t use this and Tanner didn’t post it, then who killed him?

utterance.speaker: WARBURG
utterance.content: After I heard about his death I checked out the flash drive I sent him. Someone copied my program off of it onto a USB drive. Now it wasn’t Tanner. He wouldn’t order a drone strike on himself, and it was anyone on my end, because, well – - who else is there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then it had to be someone close to Tanner with access to his work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And we only know one person like that – his assistant. Omar Dixon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, here’s my theory. Omar Dixon is working for Tanner, but he’s just scraping by. Along comes Warburg’s drone hack. Tanner doesn’t want it, but Dixon sees an opportunity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He realizes how much a drone hacking program would be worth on the open market.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. He burns a copy, learns how to use it. The next step is a real world test. And Tanner’s a cheap bastard anyway, so – – I’ll get it. For Richard Castle press one. For Beckett, press two.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. How about I just talk, jackass? So, I put out an APB on Omar Dixon, but it looks like he’s already in the wind. His girlfriend says he packed a bag and snuck out down the fire escape.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Circulate his photo to airports and bus and train stations.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Already on it.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, I sure do appreciate you finding Simon Warburg for me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was that what you’re hoping for when you gave us his name?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Oh, I just thought you might think of something that we hadn’t. When I pinged your cell phone I realized I was right. FBI’s picking him up right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then it might interest you to know, he didn’t kill Tanner.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We have reason to believe it was Omar Dixon, Tanner’s assistant. The problem is, he’s on the run.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: I can help with that.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: The facial recognition system is scanning footage over the last two hours from all the main departure points.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How accurate is this thin really?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Well, if he passed in front of one of those cameras it’ll spot him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Man, talk about Big Brother. There’s got to be a way to beat the system though, right?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Wear sunglasses, let your bangs hang down over your forehead. It totally messes with the software.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What if you don’t have bangs?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Wear heavy makeup. Paint random colored shapes all over your face.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m not doing that.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: And there he is. JKF International terminal 92 minutes ago. We got him. Now it’ll track him off his face and the color of his clothes. Damn it. Omar Dixon caught a flight to Beirut. Left an hour ago. He’s gone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We reached the airline. Omar Dixon was definitely on that flight to Beirut by way of Abu Dhabi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why Beirut?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s got family on his mom’s side and dual citizenship. He flew out on a Lebanese passport.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can we have him detained when he lands?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, there’s a no extradition agreement. Probably why he went there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And it’s an excellent part of the world if you want to sell some drone hacking software.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Speaking of drone hacking, say hello to our friend Omar Dixon.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: See you later, Omar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I thought he was heading to Beirut.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: He was. Until I asked the Attorney General to contact the FAA and have them recall the flight back to JFK. One of the perks of working for an 800 pound gorilla.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you already interview him?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Well, you’re the reason we got him, Detective Beckett. Why don’t you do the honors?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Look at that. How she uses the silence. She’s a force to be reckoned with.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ha, you don’t know the half of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Omar, right now your bags are being searched for a USB drive. Your best bet it to tell me the truth before it turns up.

utterance.speaker: OMAR
utterance.content: I told you the truth. I had nothing to do with what happened to Tanner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why did you flee the country?

utterance.speaker: OMAR
utterance.content: Because I like being alive, that’s why. Somebody put a bomb in his car. I had people chasing me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You and I both know there was no bomb.

utterance.speaker: OMAR
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You used the software hack to fire a missile from a drone.

utterance.speaker: OMAR
utterance.content: You’re out of your mind. Why is this happening to me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re going to sit there and tell me that you had no idea about the flash drive Warburg gave Tanner?

utterance.speaker: OMAR
utterance.content: I had an idea, sure. Tanner sent me to pick it up from the dead drop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: At which time you copied it.

utterance.speaker: OMAR
utterance.content: I never copied anything! I didn’t even know what was on it. The next day, Tanner said he didn’t want it, and so he told me to return the flash drive to the dead drop so that’s what I did. That’s all I did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did anyone else know about the flash drive or have access to it?

utterance.speaker: OMAR
utterance.content: Yeah. Just one person.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Shawn. You mind if we come in?

utterance.speaker: SHAWN
utterance.content: I guess.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s your mom, Shawn?

utterance.speaker: SHAWN
utterance.content: She went to get groceries. What’s up? Is there news about my dad?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We talked to Omar. He said you started dropping by the office two months ago, mostly when your dada wasn’t around.

utterance.speaker: SHAWN
utterance.content: I like hanging with Omar. So what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or was it to connect with your dad? I mean, two months ago, that’s when he moved out, wasn’t it?

utterance.speaker: SHAWN
utterance.content: Okay, I – I’m not exactly sure why we’re talking about this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that why you went to the college where he taught classes? So you could connect? I mean, it had to be hard, Shawn, having a father like that. So absent. So driven. A crusader who put his mission above all else, even the people who loved him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Warburg’s drone hack was copied onto a 4 gig USB drive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It just so happens you bought the same kind of drive the day that copy was made.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You called your dad, you asked him to meet with you because you wanted to know exactly where he would be. Isn’t that right, Shawn?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what pushed you over the edge, Shawn? Was it when you found out about the affair?

utterance.speaker: SHAWN
utterance.content: My mom held us together. Dad was always gone. We never had any money. We were being watched all the time. No friends, because of all the rumor and whispers. And that was it. That was our life. Also, he could expose wrongdoing and hold the authorities accountable. What about his family? Why didn’t we matter as much as some stupid scandal? And then, after all of it, after everything he put us through, he leaves my mom for another woman?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you wanted to make him pay.

utterance.speaker: SHAWN
utterance.content: He broke her heart! Me. He broke mine, too.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How about a nice glass of Zinfandel when we get back to my place?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: After the day we’ve had today that sounds great.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Detective Beckett and Mr. Castle. Both the President and the Attorney General have asked me to convey their thanks for your work on this case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t suppose the President’s appreciation could come in the form of a blurb for my book?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s not gonna happen. But Detective Beckett, could I have a word?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Let me ask you something. Where do you see yourself five years from now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I haven’t really given it that much thought.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: As Lieutenant? Captain? At 1 Police Plaza, climbing the ladder?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s not really where my heart is.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Where is your heart? In that room? You want to be in that room five years from now busting some killer’s balls?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know you. Certainly not well enough to have this conversation.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: I used to work homicide, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hm.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Chicago. ‘til some guy tapped me on the shoulder. Today I’m that guy. What I’m saying is this. I think you’re exceptional. You’re smart. You’re strong. You’re an asymmetrical thinker. I see bigger things for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who says I want bigger things?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: Practically everything about you screams it. There’s a job opening in DC.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What job?

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: With the Attorney General. We report directly to him, we work with total autonomy on the biggest, most challenging cases. Cases like this. Where the stakes are high and the outcome can affect history. Not everybody has what it takes for the job. I think you do. Call that number to schedule an interview. Think about it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I will.

utterance.speaker: STACK
utterance.content: I’ll be talking to you, Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you can rest easy, Castle. It looks like the Rise of the Machines is still a few years off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s what the autonomous drones want you to think.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well the fact is, an autonomous drone would never have killed Dale Tanner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm, that’s true. Because with people, observations are personal. And where one person might see roses another may see the chance to move on from an old life and on to a new one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The human factor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The human factor. And this human needs a shower. Care to join me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll be there in a minute.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You never did tell me what Stack wanted to talk to you about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nothing. It’s nothing.
